featured.text: In front of each easy chair there was a microphone at head height, with wires leading to a tape-recorder in the middle of the floor.
I always call out floors very clearly, and I am constantly on the move.
When you use a bug bomb, a chemical mixture rains down on your counters, furniture, floors, and walls, leaving behind oily and toxic substances.
Instead, he would be fined a penny for each of the 110 floors he had climbed.
The area produces 200,000 tons a year of prickly pear cactus—up to 10 tons of which ends up as waste on the floor of the cactus market each day.

other.text: On the floor (30) three dead chickens.
The clouds parted and a _____ of light fell on the church, through the windows, and onto the floor.
On the tape-recorder in the middle of the floor. (B) Through hidden microphones.
That is, after he 16 his pages in the hymn book with small bits of paper, the small pieces would invariably fall out all over the floor.

definition.zh_def: 地面或樓層，通常指建築物內部的平坦表面。
definition.en_def: The lower surface of a room on which one may walk; a level of a building.
definition.example: She dropped her keys on the floor.
